main event: On September 16, 1953 in Westbury, Long Island, N.Y., a cigar-shaped, dark colored object, possibly a balloon, was observed for 2-4 seconds. No photographs were taken, and the conclusion was inconclusive, with possibilities including balloon, aircraft, and astronomical causes.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for only 2-4 seconds, providing a very brief observation window.
The object was described as cigar-shaped, dark, and fluorescent, falling front and rear with no sound.
The report concludes that the object possibly could be a balloon, aircraft, or have an astronomical origin due to insufficient data.
There were no photographs of the observed object despite the brief duration of the sighting.
The estimated speed of the object was reported to be 0-90 M.P.H., and the distance was not available.
